title: Anonymous Message Board
text: The final project I did for freeCodeCamp to receive a Full Stack certification. The app involves CRUD operations, password hashing and security features. It was a lot of fun.

title: Pomodoro Clock
text: A timer that has changeable session and break lengths. Uses React for rendering changes along with css for styling. I've always enjoyed working with React!

title: Stock Price Checker
text: Pulls stock price data from IEX API. This was the first time I used routes with a request. I thought this would be a nice mobile app so I decided to practice with Bootstrap.

title: JavaScript Calculator
text: Simple calculator using JavaScript, and also jQuery. First time I really used JavaScript within an app. It was a lot of fun and I gained some good experience from it.

title: Bar Graph
text: My first experience using D3 along with requesting data from an external source. It was a good learning experience where I had to visualize the data in a bar graph.

title: Exercise Tracker
text: An app for fCC that uses CRUD operations. Used Mongoose to make a schema for my database that is hosted on mLab. Had fun on this project working with databases again.

title: Choropleth Map
text: Uses Data Driven Documents (D3) to better visualize data, along with styling from CSS. Uses two different requests which was a first along with TopoJSON for topography.

title: Issue Tracker
text: Tracks issues that client inputs. Uses mLab for database hosting, Mocha/Chai for testing, and Helmet for security. More experience working with databases that I enjoyed.

title: Drum Machine
text: This was a fun and simple React app. Any of the nine key presses or button click ends with a specific audio sound being played. This was great in helping me learn more about React.

title: Heatmap
text: Another data visualization app using D3. This one cross examines data by both year and month separating them into blocks. Found a cool way to use a pre-defined color set.

title: URL Shortener
text: A URL shortener that returns the shortened version as a link to a website. One of my first back-end apps that I made for the fCC curriculum. It helped me get more familiar with databases.

title: Markdown Previewer
text: My second React app. Always thought these previewers were cool so it was fun to make one myself. It was also a nice hands-on experience using React again.
